intro: Galphimia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf galphimia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright yellow, tubular flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, often in open woodland or scrub habitats. Galphimia angustifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types.
